ingredients: 3-4 lbs of chicken on the bone, with the skin on, thighs and/or breasts or whole chicken quartered
16 baby white onions, also known as pearl onions, trimmed
2-3 carrots, peeled and chopped into 1 inch pieces
1 1/2 Cups mushrooms, quartered (I prefer baby Portabella's for their flavor)
2 TB Brandy (just buy a mini-bottle if you're not a Brandy drinker)
2 Cups white wine (I prefer using a Pinot Grigio for this dish)
1 TB finely chopped Italian flat-leaf parsley (no biggie if you use dried here)
1/4 ts white pepper (use black if that's all you have but white has a more delicate flavor to it)
3-4 sprigs fresh thyme or 1/4 ts dried if you must, but it is better with fresh
